recap_documents.description: Order Referring Case to Magistrate Judge

docket_entries.description: STANDING REFERRAL ORDER: 1) This case is referred to the presiding Magistrate Judge at Covington to supervise discovery and pretrial proceedings. Unless otherwise ordered by the court, the case will revert back to the undersigned to hold the final pretrial conference and trial. 2) in connection with such reference, the said Magistrate Judge is authorized to conduct all pretrial and status conferences, to hold such hearings as may be required, and to ruleon nondispositive motions, except motions in limine. Dispositive motions and motions in limine will be referred by the Clerk to the undersigned. Subject to other provisions of law, the final pretrialconference and trial will also be before the undersigned, unless the parties agree to a trial by a Magistrate Judge, pursuant to 28 U.S.C. ยง 636(c). Signed by Judge William O. Bertelsman on 6/18/2010.(TJZ)cc: COR (Entered: 02/20/2019)

TRANSCRIPT REQUEST of Oral Argument on Motion to Dismiss by WP Company LLC for proceedings held on 7/1/2019 before Judge Bertelsman.. (Geisen, William) (Entered: 07/10/2019)

TRANSCRIPT of Proceedings: ORAL ARGUMENT held on 7/1/2019 before Judge William O. Bertelsman. Court Reporter: Joan Averdick, Telephone number (859) 291-9666. Transcript ordered by: Todd V. McMurtry, Esq. IMPORTANT NOTICE - REDACTION OF TRANSCRIPTS: In order to remove personal identifier data from the transcript, a party must follow the Court's policy regarding the Redaction Responsibility of Counsel and Parties. The policy governing the redaction of personal information is located on the court website at www.kyed.uscourts.gov. Read this policy carefully. Sample forms, i.e., a Notice of Intent to Redact, may be found on the court website by clicking on Local Forms. If there are no redactions requested, the court will assume redaction of personal identifiers is not necessary and the transcript will be made available via PACER 90 days from today's date. The Transcript may be viewed at the court public terminal or purchased through the Court Reporter before the deadline for Release of Transcript Restriction. Redaction Request due 8/5/2019. Redacted Transcript Deadline set for 8/15/2019. Release of Transcript Restriction set for 10/11/2019. (Entered: 07/10/2019)
Clerk's Note: re 45 Transcript Request. Clerk provided request to Court Reporter Joan Averdick. (ECO)
OPINION & ORDER: That the Post's motion to dismiss 27 be, and is hereby GRANTED. Signed by Judge William O. Bertelsman on 7/26/2019.(ECO)cc: COR (Entered: 07/26/2019)
JUDGMENT: That the Complaint herein be, and is hereby, DISMISSED WITH PREJUDICE. Signed by Judge William O. Bertelsman on 7/26/2019.(ECO)cc: COR (Entered: 07/26/2019)

***FILE SUBMITTED TO CHAMBERS of William O. Bertelsman for review: 58 Notice of Filing, (ECO)

ORDER: 1) The motion of the plaintiff for relief from judgment underRule 60, reconsideration of the Court's previous Order granting defendant's motion to dismiss under Rule 59, and for leave to amend the complaint 49 be, and is hereby, GRANTED IN PART AND DENIED IN PART, consistent with the above discussion; 2) The judgment 48 previously entered herein be, and ishereby, SET ASIDE AND HELD FOR NAUGHT; 3) The proposed First Amended Complaint ( 49 -2) shall be DEEMED FILED CONCURRENTLY HEREWITH; and 4) Pursuant to Fed. R. Civ. P. 26(f), a SCHEDULING CONFERENCE is hereby SET FOR TUESDAY, DECEMBER 3, 2019 AT 1:00 P.M. in the Court's third floor conference room. The parties must comply with all requirements of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure in preparation for such conference. The Court will, inter alia, set discovery deadlines at this conference, resolve anyanticipated issues regarding discovery to the extent possible, and set a deadline for the filing of motions for summary judgment. The scheduling conference will also serve as a preliminary pretrial conference which will address the following: a. Will the defendant seek to file a third-partycomplaint against the other media entities or individuals who are alleged to have defamed plaintiff? See KRS 411.182, Fed. R. Civ. P. 14, 19? b. Should the cases now pending, or to be filed later, arising out of the same event be consolidated, as contemplated by KRS 411.182? c. Is the Court required to order the joinder of any parties under Fed. R. Civ. P. 19? d. The applicability, with regard to punitive damages, of Exxon Shipping Co. v. Baker, 554 U.S. 471 (2008); BMW of North America, Inc. v. Gore, 517 U.S. 559(196); and Clark v. Chrysler Corp., 436 F.3d 594 (6th Cir. 2006). Signed by Judge William O. Bertelsman on 10/28/2019.(ECO)cc: COR (Entered: 10/28/2019)

JOINT REPORT of Rule 26(f) Planning Meeting. (McMurtry, Todd) (Entered: 01/03/2020)

MINUTE ENTRY ORDER FOR SCHEDULING CONFERENCE held on 1/7/2020 before Judge William O. Bertelsman: Parties present as noted. IT IS ORDERED that: (1) The parties shall submit a proposed agreed order on or before Monday, January 13, 2020, setting forth a proposed timeline for plaintiff's filing of any additional suits in this Court; (2) On or before Tuesday, January 21, 2020, plaintiff and CNN shall file a joint status report advising the Court of how they propose to finalize their settlement and, given that plaintiff is a minor, what approval they will need to seek from this and any other Court; and (3) Completion of the scheduling conference and commencementof any discovery are hereby STAYED pending further order of the Court. (Court Reporter JOAN AVERDICK.) Signed by Judge William O. Bertelsman on 1/8/2020. (ECO)cc: COR (Entered: 01/08/2020)
Proposed Agreed Order by Nicholas Sandmann. (McMurtry, Todd) (Entered: 01/13/2020)
***FILE SUBMITTED TO CHAMBERS of William O. Bertelsman for review: 73 Proposed Agreed Order re 72 Minute Entry Order. (ECO)

AGREED ORDER: 1. On or before Monday, February 17, 2020, Plaintiff shall file a status report advising the Court of any additional lawsuits that have been filed in this Court and any additional lawsuits that may be filed in this Court concerning the events of January 18, 2019, at the National Mall. 2. Pursuant to the agreement reached at the January 7, 2020, conference, Plaintiff shall endeavor in good faith to file any additional lawsuit(s) that he expects to file in this Court concerning a republication of the statements of Nathan Phillips that Plaintiff "blocked" Phillips and "would not allow him to retreat" on January 18, 2019 at the National Mall, on or before March9, 2020, without prejudice to Plaintiff's right to file additional lawsuits prior to the expiration of the applicable statute of limitations. 3. After responsive pleadings have been filed in any additional lawsuits that have been commenced, the parties will file a status report proposing a new date to hold a joint Rule 26(t) Conference. Signed by Judge William O. Bertelsman on 1/15/2020.(ECO)cc: COR (Entered: 01/15/2020)
